Consult and Scheduling Process Consultative Store and Forward TeleDermatology uses a two-consult process: 1. PCPs with imagers need to provide the patient?s history so the reader can properly interpret images. Depending on which templates have been adopted by the local program, the PCP is required to provide a minimal history or a complete history. To ensure effective imaging and interpretation, the referring clinician needs to effectively communicate to the imager the areas of concern to photograph. This should include information regarding anatomic locations and the need for dermatoscope images where applicable. Agreement on these processes should be developed and communicated to all involved staff. 2. Once the imager receives the consult request, the patient will either have a walk-in or imaging appointment scheduled for them. The imager will transmit the referring provider?s medical history, TeleDermatology-Telehealth Clinical 11 January 2023 Service Model Manual Revision 5 supplement it if required by conducting a structured interview, take the requested images, and ensure the quality of the images before loading them into VistA Imaging or another approved software program. The imager will then document the visit and close the consult. The imager will submit a consult to the appropriate Dermatology Service TeleReader program. 3. The dermatologist will access the consult via TeleReader and review the images and history provided. This may occur on a different day than the acquisition of the images. The dermatologist then creates a visit for the reading encounter and completes the consult with recommendations of care to the referring provider. The imager and the referring provider are notified of consult completion. The PCP is responsible for initiating treatment and education for the patient. 4. The timeliness of reading the images from the imager to the TeleReader/dermatologist is of utmost importance. The time to read an image/data for Asynchronous/Store and Forward Telehealth is measured by monitoring the number of consults pending and completed at three, seven, and 30 business days from the date of the patient-side imaging encounter entry to the date of the reader side encounter entry. VA requires Asynchronous/Store and Forward Telehealth consults to be completed within seven days. 5. Asynchronous/Store and Forward Telehealth images must be read in 30 business days or less. Telehealth encounters will match up at 30 business days. If images or data are not read or interpreted within 30 business days, they are forever unmatched or forever an orphan.
